fields.description:
I have renamed a status (From "Ablage" back to "Resolved", see attached image).
On the view of the workflow steps the name of the status remains the same. Why?

Instead, it should be possible to map an unknown status to an existing status, so that the issues can still be accessed afterwards.

{quote}
*Cause:*

*Stack Trace: [hide]*

fields.description:
When a comment is deleted we should fire a COMMENT_DELETED event instead of the ISSUE_UPDATED event.

Currently the comment deletion just throws the ISSUE_UPDATED event. It would probably be nicer to be throwing a more specific event.
fields.summary: When a comment is deleted we should fire a COMMENT_DELETED event instead of the ISSUE_UPDATED event

fields.description: If you have a long value in a text field (e.g. a long URL which cannot be hyphenated) or a long table in a wiki-comment field, then the web layout is stretched horizontally.  This means that the top right-hand side navigation (Return to search, Next, Previous buttons) are not visible unless you use the horizontal scroll bar. Can you fix this in place or move elsewhere so it is not stretched out of view?
fields.summary: Long text stretches right-hand navigation out of sight so you must use horizontal scroll bar to see it

fields.description: The Assign event should provide an option to add the old/previous assignee to a running multi-user picker field of CC/interested parties.  This could either be a system fied or a custom field that is added to the Assign Issue page that comes up when you click the Assign operation.
fields.summary: Reassignment should add previous assignee to a running CC/interested parties list

fields.description: Add ability to specify dependant bugs at creation time. It would save a fair amount of effort if a link dependancy can be specified when at the time that a bug is created, similar to what Bugzilla does.
fields.summary: Add ability to specify dependant bugs at creation time

fields.description:
We need to request a new code-signing certificate from Thawte as our current one is about to expire.  

Info here: http://www.thawte.com/ssl-digital-certificates/technical-support/keygen/
fields.summary: Update the code signing certificate used for the installer and screenshot applet

fields.description:
Currently it's only possible to attach files to individual JIRA issues.
It would be quite helpful it if were possible to add (attach) files also to individual Releases of a Project.
This would be good for archiving of product's binaries (executables, DLLs etc), source code, various release-related files etc.
Attachment security would be necessary as we want only certain groups of users access only certain attachments.
fields.summary: Ability to add attachments and set access permissions per Project's Release

fields.description:
Hello Team,

While working on JIRA, I have found a small improvement/enhancement that can be high ROI to its users. When I create a report/filter in JIRA and view it. It displays all the data as required on web/HTML page but when I export the same report in any other format like XLS; lot of required values gets changed. For example: Original/Remaining Estimate and Time Spent appears in Person Days on Web/HTML page but the generated report for the same displays all the values in seconds. And it takes effort (little) to convert these values to Person Days.

This is very small but basic enhancement which I think needs to be there if we are using JIRA as our project management tool or its data/values to create our Project plan.

I would appreciate if you could spare time and though on this proposed enhancement.

Thanks for your time and efforts.  

Regards,
SAMUEL JOSEPH | Sr. Lead QA | GlobalLogic Inc
fields.summary: Exported Report Displays Effort Estimate values in SECONDS, it should be same as report on web/HTML as in Person Days

fields.description:
Everytime a new product is added I have to remember all the things to do to get it set up with configurations, contexts, custom fields, etc.  It would save a lot of time setting things up everytime a new product is introduced if it could be done once within a Category. Then I should be able to copy the Category to create a new one, and all of its settings would be carried over.  

I understand the benefits of having product and issue level configuration flexibility - so that should remain as is and would override the Category settings.

How about it?
fields.summary: I would like it if all configurations, e.g. screens, schemes, custom fields, etc. could be set up on a Category Basis.

fields.description: When assigning a new workflow to a project, any new issues created before this (lengthy) process is completed use the old workflow, and when the process completes the issues are not moved to the new workflow causing inconsistencies.
fields.summary: When assigning a workflow to a project new issues are created with the old workflow and not converted
Need to add Tomcat 6.0 documentation

fields.description:
If JIRA is started up and the first thing it is asked to do is to concurrently generate sequences of the same table, a race condition can occur that causes the sequence generation to fail.

The following is logged:
{noformat}
2007-05-04 12:28:19,885 indexerPool-1-thread-2 ERROR [ofbiz.core.entity.SequenceUtil] [SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.fillBank] maxTries (5) reached, giving up.
2007-05-04 12:28:19,885 indexerPool-1-thread-2 ERROR [ofbiz.core.entity.SequenceUtil] [SequenceUtil.SequenceBank.getNextSeqId] Fill bank failed, returning null
{noformat}

The cause is that the {{SequenceBank.fillBank()}} is called from the constructor of the {{SequenceBank}} before it is assigned to the map, so multiple SequenceBanks for the same sequence can be created - and they tend to get in each other's way. Solution is to synchronise the construction of the SequenceBanks.
fields.summary: Race condition when starting up the Ofbiz Sequence Generator

A customer's JIRA instance is hanging due to a bulk edit taking out the Lucene index lock, preventing other issues being updated. 

See [support.atlassian.com JSP 12235|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-12235] for the whole description. 

Kind regards,
Ian

fields.description:
A lot of customers have several services that JIRA/Confluence depends on configured in Windows such as:
* MySQL
* JIRA
* Confluence
* Crowd

It is important that these get started in the correct order if they are installed as services.  The following MS article contains information about how to do this:http://support.microsoft.com/kb/193888   We should update our docs to link to this information (Note: This should probably be done for all products)
fields.summary: Add information about starting windows services in the correct sequence

fields.description:
The issue field "Due Date" has the wrong translation in the Simplified Chinese language pack.

It's now 预期日期 , but should be 逾期日期. While the first means "expected date", the second means "due date".
fields.summary: "Due Date" translation error in Simplified Chinese language pack

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12676].
  {panel}

Would be nice if it was possible if an IssueEventListener had a method that is called back when issue's watcher have been added/removed.
This can be a single event  like WatchersModified containing the issue.

We need this functionality to implement an extension that would populate issue's watchers into sub-tasks' watchers - seems doesn't supported by Jira itself.
If there is another way of doing it, then probably the event may not be needed.
fields.summary: Watchers related event needed

fields.description: Having a comma in the group name potentially can break the "Assign Group to Project Role" page. It's either disallow comma in group name or to better handle the group names field.
fields.summary: Disallowing comma in group name?

fields.description:
Hi,

Yesterday I installed JIRA WAR/EAR on Tomcat 5.5.23 following the [Installing JIRA on Tomcat 5.5|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/servers/tomcat55.html] guide.

When I got to the [Fix Tomcat memory leak|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/servers/tomcat55.html#memleak] section, it said to edit Tomcat's bin/setenv.sh file. However Tomcat did not have a bin/setenv.sh file. I didn't know what to do, so I ignored it.

What should I do if setenv.sh does not exist. Simply create it? We need to update the doco with whatever the correct thing to do is. Sorry, a bit of googling didn't find me the answer, and anyone who I think might know the answer is busy on more important things right now, and I don't want to lose the issue.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: JIRA installation guide for Tomcat 5.5 has imcomplete info on modifying setenv.sh

fields.description:
Earlier this week I corrected a minor error in the JIRA Installation Guide, where the generic [Server Comparison|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/servers/index.html#Which+server+should+I+use%3F] said that we support Weblogic 7.0 and 8.1, but the [Weblogic specific guide|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/servers/weblogic.html] says that we also support 9.1. (I added 9.1 to the generic comparison page.

I have just noticed that the generic page suggests using the latest Tomcat 5.0 release, but the Tomcat 5.5 guide says that we ourselves now use 5.5.9 in the standalone version. This needs updating.

It strikes me that we have an ongoing documentation maintenance issue while we have information about supported versions in both places - i.e. in the generic guide and in the app server-specific guide. Could we perhaps restructure the documentation in some way so that this information is only in one place, probably in the vendor-specific guide.

Kind regards,
Ian
fields.summary: JIRA Installation Guide has inconsistent info in Server Comparison to Server-specific Guides

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12672].
  {panel}

The new [support.atlassian.com|http://support.atlassian.com] workflow is a great example for customers of how to use JIRA as a support system. Perhaps, once it is bedded down, we should write up how we went about it, showing Tony's state transition diagram and then going into a high level description of how we implemented it.

Perhaps it could be an update of Jeff's [JIRA as a support system|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+as+a+support+system] page.

Cheers,
Ian
fields.summary: Documentation of new support.atlassian.com workflow

fields.description:
If a field has been hidden or is not in a context for an issue, it will be displayed on the confirmation page for move or convert issue, if the system thinks it has a value.

The system will think it has a value if it is calculated field or if it has a value in the database.  (i.e. the field used to be in context or not hidden, was given a value and then removed from context or hidden).

When retrieving removed fields, we must find the intersection of all hidden fields for the target context and all displayed fields in the current context.

This should be done in DefaultIssueConversionService.getRemovedFields()
fields.summary: Unassociated calculated fields are displayed on confirmation pages of Move and Convert issue, even when not in context

fields.description:
The interface for these objects has getters for the Project and ProjectRole objects. Currently we cache references to instances of them. While this works at the moment as we only actually use their immutable properties (basically the ID), it means there exists all sorts of potential for problems if the cached versions are accessed after the actual database entities have been modified.

Essentially all we need are the IDs, perhaps consider ProjectID and ProjectRoleID interfaces?
fields.summary: DefaultRoleActor and ProjectRoleActor implementations should not hold references to the ProjectRole and Project objects

fields.description: Currently, we only respect the External user management flag in the bugzilla import bean, to warn the user that new users will have to be created in their external user management system (i.e. LDAP).  This should be extended to also support the external password management flag.
fields.summary: Make the bugzilla importer respect external password flag

fields.description:
The DocumentSortComparatorSource leaks instance of the indexReader into the comparator created causing memory leak. The FieldSortedHitQueue maintains a weak hashmap of indexReader -> Comparator mappings.  In the case of the DocumentSortcomparator, the indexReader itself is referenced by the comparator, and the weakHashmap therefore can never release all the mappings held onto by that indexReader.  Over time this results in a memory leak.  

It looks like only the 'Last time commented'  custom field from the JIRA Toolkit uses this comparator currently.  The problem only occurs if the issue navigator is sorted by this field.  It is therefore quite rare for this to occur and should be treated as a fairly low priority bug.
fields.summary: CustomFields using the DocumentSortComparatorSource may cause a memory leak when sorting

fields.description: In Bugzilla it is possible to reply to a comment.  This is a useful feature because it allows to relate the comments.  It is much easier to understand the issue when comments are related especially if you have a lot of comments.
fields.summary: It is not possible to reply to a comment.

fields.description:
When a project has a lot of versions, it can be very slow to look at the Change Log tab within Browse Project.

For example, if I look at the change log today, I see 3.8.1, 3.8.1 Professional, and 3.8.1 Enterprise listed.  If I want to look at 3.8 or even 3.7, I must change the scope to 'All Versions'.  Because of the number of versions and numbers of issues, it takes a minute or two for this very large page to come back.

It would be helpful if we could page through 3 releases at a time or provide a higher level summary of the releases to keep the page more manageable.
fields.summary: Add paging/optimization for Change Log scope

fields.description: The default transition (id=5) called "Resolve Issue" has been renamed in our workflow.  However, when we upgraded to 3.8.1, the renamed transition shows as "Resolve Issue" on the user side.  However, in the workflow editor, it clearly says something different.  This was working fine until 3.8.1 upgrade.  I have tried to reapply the workflow to the project, but that did not help.
fields.summary: Default Transition of "Resolve Issue" showing as "Resolve Issue" on action regardless of renaming in custom workflow

fields.description:
We should not use system specific file separator for email templates as they are read off the classpath.

Places where a system specific separator is used stop working when deploying a closed war on windows. Open war works.

We need to simply hardcode forward slash as Java takes care of this on all operating systems.

The bug is in com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.JiraSupportRequest file

For more information on this type of problem see JRA-11739.
fields.summary: System specific file separator is used for send support request e-mail template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12650].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. For the specific use case described below (users creating support tickets) we recommend [JIRA Service Desk|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk], which is built for internal support on JIRA. For other types of customization, please check out the add-ons mentioned in the comments ([Enterprise Mail Handler for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.javahollic.jira.jemh-ui] and [Email This Issue|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue]).

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently, under User Default Settings, Jira allows you to decide whether users should be notified of their own changes.  We've found that it is absolutely necessary to have that setting set to "NO" -- that is, users should NOT be notified of their own changes.  Otherwise, entirely too many notifications are sent out.  This creates an issue, however.  Our users are accustomed to receiving an acknowledgment that their support emails have been received.  We cannot figure out a way to have such an email sent out from Jira while the "Notify users of their own changes?" setting is set to "NO".
fields.summary: There needs to be some way to send out an email acknowledgment for issues created via email handler
CreateOrComment handler should accept emails without a subject or reply with a failure notice
README.txt contains out of date information about mailing-list

fields.description:
Project Name, Key and Lead are not validated when creating a CSV config file for importing into a new project. 

If you select the "Import issues into a new project" radio button on the CSV importer page and leave the project-related fields blank, the importer ignores them and creates a config file for importing into another project without warning.

We should also validate the config file when attempting to use it to import, in case it has been manually changed by the user.
fields.summary: CSV Importer: Project details are not validated when importing into a new project

fields.description: In Google mail, JIRA "comment", "updated", "closed" (etc) email notifications never get integrated properly into the same "conversation". Each appears separately. Being able to follow the issue's conversation is [important to people|http://www.nabble.com/-Vote--move-defect-tracking-from-bugzilla-to-Jira-tf3639534.html#a10163843] when the email volume is high.
fields.summary: GMail does not thread JIRA notification emails

fields.description: It'll be great to have some drag-drop re-arranging of issue navigator results. The drop would update an ordering custom field ID which could be used as a prioritization measurement.
fields.summary: Drag-drop ajaxy type sorting/rearranging on IssueNavigator results

fields.description: As discussed for confluence (CONF-8046 and USER-105), we really need the ability in Jira to dynamically populate groups from LDAP attributes. Today, we have to manage a large number of static groups to map the need of the different teams (depending on the projects, roles and regions), while our Systems engineers are already doing that job for corporate systems.
fields.summary: Support LDAP dynamic groups

fields.description:
The 'Show saved Filter' portlet is displaying a list of issues, up to a maximum value. Such maximum also determines the height of the portlet in the Jira page, as it is rendered with the page.
The following improvement would greatly improve the interest and performance of this portlet:
. The list of issues is asynchronously rendered in a DIV in the Jira page. The portlet rendering only inserts such DIV in the Jira page, with the necessary javascript that will get the issues list during the page rendering on the browser side.
. The height of the portlet is now a different setting from the maximum number of issues
. The limit to the number of issues displayed can then be greatly increased, as a vertical scrollbar in the DIV would allow quick scrolling in the list
fields.summary: 'Show saved Filter' portlet: 'Ajax like' rendering

fields.description:
he columns displayed in the "Show saved filter" portlet are hardcoded, depending on the issue type.
It would be nice to be able to customize them, in order to have the info we want directly from the dashboard.
For example, for the bugs/features opened on the current version, I would like to see the assignee, and not just the ticket id/description/priority.
fields.summary: 'Show saved Filter': offer the ability to edit Columns displayed in the preview

fields.description:
We have implemented the Subversion Plugin.
I think it is a bug that the tab "Subversion Commits" can only seen by users which are member of the group "jira-developers".
Why is it not allowed to "jira-users"? 
Why is this connected to a user group?
fields.summary: Tab "Subversion Commits" only visible to members of group "jira-developers"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12615].
  {panel}

When using the JIRA windows installer and clicking "Install JIRA as a service", the windows service is created under the name "Atlassian JIRA Enterprise Edition 3.8.1". 

This is very impractical, because

- the service name is very long
- it has spaces, which breaks shell scripts (at least makes it more difficult to write them)
- it has a release number in the name which is certainly bad practice
-  you can't execute "net stop JIRA" anymore
- the existing Atlassian documentation is using JIRA as the service name.

Please make it a short name without spaces, such as "JIRA". Should be also trivial to fix.
fields.summary: Windows service name is too long and impractical
Include formating styles for Excel view

fields.description:
When viewing an issue, there is no easy way to work out which comments by a user are in relation to which files attached by a user.

The user will typically write "See attached for a screenshot of the problem." But with multiple attachments it becomes very easy to lose track of which attachment relates to which comment. Users must be forced to refer to their attachment by filename so that viewers can understand which attachment relates to their comment.

A better way would be to link to the attachment not only in the attachments section but also in the box for the comment that was submitted along with that attachment.

That way attachments would be accessible in both areas - attachments section and comments section.
fields.summary: Correlation between attachments and their associated comments in issue view

fields.description:
Last week we created a brand new Issue Type Scheme for 5 of the support Projects in our internal JIRA system.  I migrated all 5 of these projects across to the new issue type scheme however JIRA now displays some issue data incorrectly.

Some of the things I have noticed is:

1. Some of the issues appear to have been "moved" into other projects(even though we didn't explicity move them) 
2. Some of the issue types across all projects did not migrate across.  They suddently couldn't be found in issue navigator so I organised a full re-index of JIRA and then they appeared again and I was able to manually migrate the existing issues across.
3. Some of the workflows in existing issues appear to have broken. You cannot use them, although if you create a new issue the workflow is fine in that new issue.

This seems to be extremely "buggy" behaviour from JIRA. Have you come across this kind of thing happening before when moving whole projects across to new Issue Type Schemes? Is it a problem with version 3.6.1 of JIRA?
fields.summary: Issue Type Scheme migration problems for existing Projects

fields.description:
If I:
 # define a permission scheme granting the "JIRA Users" role the Browse permission: !projectroles.png!
 # in each project, map the 'jira-users' group to the project's JIRA Users role (this will be done automatically if 'jira-users' is configured as a role default member): !permscheme.png!

Then many parts of JIRA (notably dashboards) can run slowly if you have many users. With 45,000 users, a standard dashboard will take ~10s to render. If the 'jira-users' group is mapped directly to the Browse permission (logically equivalent), the same dashboard takes 300ms to render.
fields.summary: Poor performance with large numbers of Users in roles.

fields.description:
When editing or creating a custom field, the administration interface refers to a "Search Template" and a re-index option.  There is no reference to how custom field searching differs from non-custom field searching, namely how custom field queries in the "Quick Search" field will not return results.  This behavior should be explicitly noted in the documentation and on the interface, otherwise a user or administrator have the potential to be confused and frustrated when trying to implement and use custom fields.

The documentation refers to a search template and to allowing searching through the issue navigator, but says nothing regarding quick search (http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.8/customfields/overview.html#Search+templates):

??Search templates are responsible for indexing a custom field as well as making it searchable through the issue navigator. Each of the default custom field types have a related pre-configured search template.??

Suggested correction:

??Search templates are responsible for indexing a custom field as well as making it searchable through the issue navigator. Custom fields are not searchable through Quick Search.  Each of the default custom field types have a related pre-configured search template.??

In the EditCustomField page where it states:

??Note that changing a custom field searcher may require a re-index.??

needs to be corrected as well.  Suggested correction (can be here or in the other location on the page where it says to reindex):

??Note that custom fields cannot be searched through Quick Search, only from the Issue Navigator.  Changing a custom field searcher may require a re-index.??

An alternative and preferable fix would be to implement JRA-7686.
fields.summary: Documentation and administration interface imply that custom fields can be searched in the same manner as non-custom fields, although Quick Search for custom fields is not implemented
Better usability for multi-issue editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-12604].
  {panel}

When a customer reports a bug in our software - we need to record the details of the customer as well as the issue details. For example, we need to know the Business Name, the Manager's name, the Franchisee's name, The phone number, and the fax number of the business reporting the problem. Obviously we don't want to make these Issue fields because we don't want to record the same information each time that business reports a bug!

We can add user properties to track the information - great. But the feature is actually quite useless because you can't make these fields available in the Issue screens!

How does any user of Jira track these properties of the users? Surely this lack of functionality is a glaring shortcoming of the whole system?

Please refer to my live chat session with one of your technicians below earlier....

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
You are now chatting with Yuen Chi
Leigh Morum: Hi and thanks for taking my call 

Yuen Chi: Hi Leigh, how may I help you? 
Leigh Morum: We are evaluating Jira as we would like to use it to track issues. The problem we have is that after adding user properties - e.g. Company Name, Phone Number, Manager's name etc - we would like to make these new fields available to the help desk technicians. 

Leigh Morum: I can't find a way of adding these fields to the default screen to either display them to the technician - or to allow editing of the fields by the technician. 

Yuen Chi: User properties? May I know what's the JIRA version you are using? 
Leigh Morum: It's 3.8.something 

Leigh Morum: The latest one I just downloaded a week ago. 

Yuen Chi: Cool. 
Yuen Chi: I'm sorry to tell you that, currently the user properties feature is reserved for admin use. 
Yuen Chi: However, what I can suggest is, 
Yuen Chi: You can write custom field to extract these values, then add them to the resolve issue screen. 
Yuen Chi: May I know if you have any Java / JIRA API programmers at your side? 
Leigh Morum: OK that sounds promising! But I have no idea how to implement. I don't have any Java programmers this side so we're a bit wet behind the hears with this. 

Yuen Chi: If that's the case, we can get one of our service partners to get in touch with you regarding this issue. 
Leigh Morum: please 

Yuen Chi: If you have some techies at your side, you can get them to look at these pages:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Plugin+Guide
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Custom+Field+Plugin+Module 
Leigh Morum: Can someone call me? 

Leigh Morum: +27824530754 

Leigh Morum: or Skype username lmorum 

Yuen Chi: Can I get them to get back to you on Monday? 
Leigh Morum: Sure no problem. 

Leigh Morum: Thanks for your help 

Yuen Chi: Is lmorum@cosoft.co.za the point of contact? 
Leigh Morum: yes that e-mail is perfect 

Yuen Chi: Do you mind to give me your company name? So that I can refer this back to my manager. 
Leigh Morum: Sure - it's Coherent Software Solutions (Pty) Ltd trading as Cosoft 

Yuen Chi: Cool, thanks  
Leigh Morum: ok thanks & cheers 

Yuen Chi: Is there anything else that you'd like information on? 
Leigh Morum: One last thing 

Leigh Morum: Can I add a custom user field called Phone Number for example - to then be an available field for each user? i.e. without having to add the custom field to each and every user. 

Yuen Chi: Based on my technical understanding, yes, this is do-able. 
Leigh Morum: Currently you have to go to each user and type in Custom field "Telephone" then the value. I want the new field "Telephone" to then e available for all users. 

Yuen Chi: Oh I'm sorry, do you mean you want to apply the value through JIRA web interface on all users? 
Leigh Morum: You know how you currently go into edit a user - you just get the email address and the username. I want to get those two as well as the new "Telephone" field. i.e. Without having to add "Telephone" as a field property for each user record. 

Leigh Morum: You shouldn't have to type the word "Telephone" a thousand times if I have a thousand customer user 
s!
Leigh Morum: You should be able to create a custom field called "Telephone" and then it's available as a property for all users - not just the one. 

Yuen Chi: That's currently not possible in JIRA without customizing it. 
Leigh Morum: So it's really just a user property for a single user record? 

Yuen Chi: 
Yuen Chi: For time being and by default, yes. 
Leigh Morum: That's a great pity! The whole system looks perfect for our business - but we need to know more than just a username and password when tracking reported bugs or anything else. I would imagine other companies would be in a similar situation. 

Leigh Morum: Is there a way of getting around this issue? 

Yuen Chi: Actually, our developers would like to hear from our customers about how this should be used.

fields.description:
While versions across projects are not related in Jira, even if they share the same name, there are _special_ versions that do have the same semantics.  It is these _special_ versions that I need to be available in a filter that is specified across projects.
Because we mark a version as released as soon as it is installed on a specific environment (included in the version naming convention), we want to search for unclosed issues that have been fixed on released versions, so that we can easily see what needs to be retested.  The filter for _released versions_ is necessary because it can take a few days before the solution for an issue (from then on marked as resolved) is really installed on the test environments.

_Special_ versions for affected version
* Any
* No Version
* Released Versions
* Unreleased Versions

_Special_ versions for fix version:
* Any
* No Fix Version
* Unreleased Versions
* Released Versions

A comment of mine in JRA-1538 already talks about this improvement.  However, I think it gets lost in the huge amount of information regarding JRA-1538, while this issue is not really the same, and I think the impact is a lot smaller.
fields.summary: Enable cross-project filtering on special versions
Apply Bulk Change to Original Estimate ( Time Tracking ) field

fields.description:
The problem is with the following parsing method in *{{calendar.jsp}}*:
{code:javascript}
Date.parseDate = function(str, fmt) {
...
	var a = str.split(/\W+/);
...
{code}

Problem is that *\W* does not recognize characters such as á, ä, č, ď, é, í, ĺ, ľ, ń, ó, ô, ŕ, ř, š, ť, ú, ý, ž, etc. as valid characters for words and treats them as characters that separate words, hence the date string such as "19/máj/05" (19/May/2005) is split into ["19", "m", "j", "05"].


Under normal circumstances, parsing should result in ["19", "máj", "05"] array, which can be mapped as
|| parsed || mapped to || ||
| 19 | 19 | |
| máj | 5 | _5th month in the array is _máj_ |
| 2005 | 2005| |
However, incorrect parsing continues and causes incorrect mapping:
|| parsed || mapped to || ||
| 19 | 19 | |
| m | 3 | finds first moth starting with _m_, which is _marec_ |
| j | 2007 | _(defaults to year of today's date_ |
| 05 | | _ignored_ |
As an end result *19/May/2005* pops up in the calendar as *19/Mar/2007*.

This was replicated when looking at JRA-8703. Run JIRA with _Slovak (Slovakia)_ as default language (_Admin -> General Configuration_) or *-Duser.language=SK* from command line.

I am not sure what is the best way of fixing this.

fields.description:
Clicking User Picker icon in Assign Users to Project Role page does not bring up list of users. 

To reproduce the problem: Login as a JIRA administrator in JIRA 3.8. Click on the Administration tab. After the list of projects appears, click on any project. After the Project detail page appears, click on the "Project Roles: View Members" link. After the "Manager Project Role Membership for Project: ProjectName" appears, click on one of the Edit links in the "Users" column. After the "Assign Users to Project Role: ProjectRoleName" page appears, click on the user picker icon   in the Add User area, on right side of page. Note that Java error message "Error on page" appears in extreme lower left of browser window, and that a window containing a list of JIRA users should appear, but it does not.

fields.description:
Hello JIRA team,

I was just going through the examples of JIRA development and got stuck on the CloseParentIssue workflow function. I compiled the example and deployed it to our test server. The function itself works fine and closes the parent issue after executing (detail view of the issue is updated). When I had a look at the transitions of the issue, I saw that the transition is not available in the history list (transitions) of the issue and in the navigator, it still shows the status the issue had before executing the post function!!

After having a look at the sourcecode I recognized that the variable 'store' (type WorkflowStore) is never used! Maybe the example is not complete at all?!? 

BTW, after re-indexing the database (Administration -> Indexing), the navigator shows the correct status! 

Thanks in advance!

Regards,
Christian
fields.summary: Example CloseParentIssueFunction

fields.description:
In our [OC4J 10.x installation instructions|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/servers/oc4j101.html] we tell Oracle users that they need to set the {{setBigStringTryClob}} flag, and due to OC4J brokenness, they have to use [Atlassian's JDBC wrapper which recognises the setBigStringTryClob flag|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/oracle10g-datasource.html#orion].

Unfortunately our workaround was written for OC4J 9.x, and doesn't work in 10.1.3.x. Our docs say:

{quote}OC4J 10.1.x no longer uses the <data-source> element, but the same property can be set with a <property name="setBigStringTryClob value="true"/>element nested within the <connection-factory> element.{quote}

But this doesn't work. Using:

{code:xml}
<connection-pool name="JiraPool">
    <connection-factory factory-class="oracle.jdbc.pool.OracleDataSource" user="jiradb" 
                        password="jiradb" url="jdbc:oracle:thin:@127.0.0.1:1521:jiradb">
        <property name="setBigStringTryClob" value="true"/>
        <property name="loginTimeout" value="30"/>
    </connection-factory>
</connection-pool>
<managed-data-source name="JiraPool" jndi-name="jdbc/JiraDS" connection-pool-name="JiraPool"/>
{code}

results in this error in 10.1.3.2:

ERROR J2EE DS-00020 Exception setting the property 'setBigStringTryClob' on the DataSource. 
 Exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No such property: setBigStringTryClob, existing writable properties are: [TNSEntryName, URL, connectionCacheName, connectionCacheProperties, connectionCachingEnabled, connectionProperties, dataSourceName, databaseName, description, driverType, explicitCachingEnabled, fastConnectionFailoverEnabled, implicitCachingEnabled, logWriter, loginTimeout, maxStatements, networkProtocol, password, portNumber, serverName, serviceName, user] 
2007-04-15 23:49:19.865 WARNING J2EE OJR-00107 Exception creating connection pool.  Exception: oracle.oc4j.sql.DataSourceException: Exception setting the property 'setBigStringTryClob' on the DataSource. Exception: java.lang.IllegalArgument Exception: No such property: setBigStringTryClob, existing writable properties are: [TNSEntryName, URL, connectionCacheName, connectionCacheProperties, connectionCachingEnabled, connectionProperties, dataSourceName, databaseName, description, driverType, explicitCachingEnabled, fastConnectionFailoverEnabled, implicitCachingEnabled, logWriter, loginTimeout, maxStatements, networkProtocol, password,
 portNumber, serverName, serviceName, user] 
07/04/15 23:49:19 SEVERE: ApplicationStateRunning.initConnector Error occurred initializing connectors.  Exception is: Exception creating connection pool.  Exception: oracle.oc4j.sql.DataSourceException: Exception setting the property 'setBigStringTryClob' on the DataSource. Exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No such property: setBigStringTryClob, existing writable properties are: [TNSEntryName, URL, connectionCacheName, connectionCacheProperties, connectionCachingEnabled, connectionProperties, dataSourceName, databaseName, description, driverType, explicitCachingEnabled, fastConnectionFailoverEnabled, implicitCachingEnabled, logWriter, loginTimeout, maxStatements, networkProtocol, password, portNum ber, serverName, serviceName, user]
07/04/15 23:49:19 SEVERE: ApplicationStateRunning.initConnector Stack trace: oracle.oc4j.sql.DataSourceException: Exception creating connection pool.  Exception: oracle.oc4j.sql.DataSourceException: Exception setting the property 'setBigStringTryClob' on the DataSource. Exception: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No such property: setBigStringTryClob, existing writable properties are: [TNSEntryName, URL, connectionCacheName, connectionCacheProperties, connectionCachingEnabled, connectionProperties, dataSourceName, databaseName, description, driverType, explicitCachingEnabled, fastConnectionFailoverEnabled, implicitCachingEnabled, logWriter, loginTimeout, maxStatements, networkProtocol, password, portNumber, serverName, serviceName, user] 
at com.evermind.server.ApplicationStateRunning.initDataSourceConnectionPool(ApplicationStateRunning.java:2072) 
        at com.evermind.server.ApplicationStateRunning.initDataSourceConnector(ApplicationStateRunning.java:2017) 
        at com.evermind.server.ApplicationStateRunning.initConnector(ApplicationStateRunning.java:1272) 
....
fields.summary: Workflows over 4000 characters break in OC4j 10.1.3.x + Oracle - cannot set setBigStringTryClob workaround
Option to Print Last <n> Comments on Full Content
Make "Sub-task Progress" available as a column in Navigator and Filter Gadgets

fields.description: In serveral cases the people who are not directly related to the project are managing the tool and it has been pointed out on many occasions the act of setting up a project is complicated. We are attempting to locally "stream line" the process but I am sure others would appreciate the ability to have a long and short method of setting up a project.
fields.summary: Make setting up a project much easier.
Jelly: Added comment not being indexed / does not appear in search result

fields.description:
Logging in by specifying username/password in the URL like this:

{noformat}http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/XYZ-114?decorator=none&view=rss&os_username=LOGIN&os_password=PASSWORD{noformat}

used to work. (tested with JIRA 3.6.3)

Now you get presented with an undecorated "not logged in" message.

This issue was raised from support request [JSP-11658|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-11658]
fields.summary: Authentication via os_username and os_password URL params is broken

fields.description:
I think it would be useful to be able to label the portlets you add to the portlet pages. Because many of the portlets are designed to allow a multiple of them to be added. Once they are on their you don't know in the portlet editor which one is which.

See screen shot. (Without looking at my dashboard I don't know what project is which)
fields.summary: Labelling added portlets
Include jutf7 jar in JIRA distribution
